content:
Tom is a clean freak but he never dries his hair after a shower. How is this possible?
1. His hair is dyed.

2. He tries to stand upside down druing shower to avoid rain.
3. This man is bald.

Jessica will read the Bible every night before bed. Jessica had forgotten to buy candles for a backup one day when the electricity went out, but she still read a chapter before turning in. How is that even doable?
1. Sally is smart that she remembered all chapters in Bible.
2. Because it was daytime.
3. Sally was blind, she was reading a book by Braille.

Within Joshua Tree National Park, a couple is driving. Because there is no light in the area to improve the view, the Joshua Tree National area is well known for its starry sky. The couple travels here for the first time, and the roads are rough. Their vehicle's headlights are damaged. How did they manage to prevent being crushed?
1. The moonlight can provide additional visibility.
2. It was during the daylight hours.
3. Their eyes have the ability to adapt to low-light conditions over time.

If a boat is parked in a marina and tied to a nearby station, how did its owner found the boat a couple of hours later in the middle of the ocean?
1. The boat is towed by police.
2. The intense weather conditions flood the marina.
3. The station wasn't fixed in the marina

The coaches of the first and the fifth national basket ball champion shares the same parents, but were not brothers. How can this be possible?
1. Their parents got divorced.
2. The first coach has better performance during tenure.
3. They were the same man.

A couple is having a disagreement over the man's error. The man kept apologizing and pleading with the woman to allow him to see her directly. The woman was still upset. Thus, she wouldn't agree. The couple, though, was positioned on the same mat. How is that even doable?
1. The woman kept turning her back to the man.
2. The mat was folded in multiple times and end up with a special shape.
3. The couple was standing on two sides of the girl's apartment door, which had a rug under it.

Each of the 30 participants in the masquerade had to wear a unique hat to distinguish themselves from one another. The host, however, only tallied 29 when he counted the number of hats to determine attendance. All 30 persons had signed their names on the spreadsheet, which confused him. He repeated the count. There are still 29. How is that even doable?
1. One person had moved away from the group when the host was counting.
2. The host had a hat himself and he forget to count it.
3. One person had a pretty beautiful hat.

Two mothers and two daughters were asking for new state IDs, but the agent only gave out three forms and instructed them on how to fill them out. Why?
1. They are one daughters, one mother and one grandmother.
2. Two girls filled the from together.
3. One mother is too old to apply for new IDs.

Eight people were sitting under a large tree. Suddenly, a gust of wind blows, yet none of them got hit by any falling leaves. How is this possible?
1. It was winter and the tree doesn't have any leaves.
2. People were camping under the tree.
3. The wind blows heavily.

The ship was in the central Pacific Ocean. The ship suddenly began to sink without being crushed. However, each team was still preoccupied with its own tasks, so none was threatening. Why?
1. There are too many fish around the ship.
2. It was a Submarine.
3. An underwater earthquake caused a rapid drop in the water level and resulted in the loss of buoyancy for the ship.

There is a peculiar vase holding seven magical beans. You must distribute these beans among seven sorcerers, ensuring each one gets a bean, but still leaving one bean in the vase. How could this enchanting scenario occur?
1. Two sorcerers decide to share one apple.
2. Hand over the final bean to the seventh sorcerer without removing it from the vase.
3. One sorcerers is polite and return the apple back.

Every night, a man would sleep with a light on, as bright as the sun, dazzling the neighbors. But why did his neighbors never complain?
1. All his neighbors are blind.
2. The man would wake up early.
3. He lived in a light house.

All but one of Mr. Brown's cars are red, and all but one are blue. However, Mr. Brown only has two cars. How is this possible?
1. Mrs.Smith has one additional car that is neither a red or a blue.
2. Mrs.Smith has one car that is blue and red at the same time.
3. Mr. Brown has one red car and one blue car.

A woman shoots publicly at people at a National Park. The park is full of people, but no one gets killed. How is that possible?
1. The woman was a photographer.
2. The woman wanted to cause chaos.
3. People are enjoying themselves in the park.

Several harvested radishes were once stolen from a neighbor by a slothful farmer. The radishes were missing, so his neighbor reported it to the police. The farmer told the authorities that the radishes came from his own farm this morning. Even though he planted radishes on his own farm, he was nonetheless detained by the police anyway. How?
1. Radishes don't grow during the current season.
2. There are no dew on the raddishes, so they were not harvested from his own farm on the morning.
3. The farmer's farm did not have suitable conditions for growing radishes.

Four people sat down to play a board game. They played four rounds and each person won twice. How can this be possible?
1. The four people were playing in two teams of two each. Each team won twice.
2. The board game takes a long time to end.
3. Some rounds ended in ties or draws.

A man uses the elevator since he is too old to use his crutch to ascend to the 12th floor. He is asked to hit the 17th button by a woman who is taller than him because she is unable to do it herself. Why?
1. The old man can reach the button with the help of his crutch.
2. The old man was granted exclusive access to the higher floors.
3. The woman thinks pressing the 17th button in the elevator brings good luck or wards off bad luck.

Lily stood on the edge of the 18th floor of the high-rise apartment complex. Overwhelmed with fatigue, she opened the balcony door and stepped through. It was a steep drop from the balcony to the pavement below. Amazingly, after stepping, she was unscathed. Given that there was nothing to soften her landing or slow her descent, how could she have survived the step?
1. The ground outside the building is wet.
2. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.
3. Lily was exhausted from apartment cleaning, she opened the balcony door and stepped inside.

A chess team has five players, and each player has one coach. But there are only six participants in the team. How is that possible?
1. Each player shares the same coach.
2. Some coaches get a raise.
3. Some players are backups and not allowed to play.

When Laura, a bright young girl, shared with her parents that she intended to slice, dice, and gut for a living, they were taken aback. However, they quickly expressed their excitement for her future career. Keep in mind, her parents were not particularly violent people. Why?
1. Laura wanted to be a surgeon.
2. The parents known Laura was kiding and didn't pay attention.
3. Her parents thought the job has high salary so they are excited.

Even though Matthew has never expressed any desire to endanger himself, whenever he feels stressed or overwhelmed, he makes plans to visit a certain deep spot that he has visited many times before. Once there, he decides to plunge into the profound depth. The astonishing thing is that he has never been hurt because of his dive, and he even says he feels much better afterwards. What is happening here, and why has he never been injured or, even worse, killed as a result of his risky behavior, if he isn't trying to harm himself?
1. Matthew is a deep-sea diver.
2. Consistent exercise has made him a very strong man.
3. Matthew was just raving to show her is outstanding.

A tower suddenly moves directly to another tower, and the tower hitted vanishes. It's not a dream or an illusion. So where might this occur? 
1. On the moon.
2. On a chessboard.
3. Under the sea.

A certain kind of animal has parents but no children, lives happily but can not give birth to offspring. This kind of animal has existed on earth for a long history. How is that possible?
1. The animal is the dinosaur. Millions of years ago, dinosaurs roamed the Earth, but eventually, they became extinct due to various factors such as climate change or asteroid impact.
2. The animal is the butterfly. During the pupal stage of their life cycle, butterflies are inside a protective casing, and it may appear as if they have completely disappeared or been wiped out.
3. The animal is the Mule. Since all Mules are born sterile, you can only get a Mule by crossing a donkey with a horse.

A woman hiking along a narrow mountain path notices a fast-approaching grizzly bear. Instead of immediately stepping off the path, she sprints directly towards the bear for about twenty feet and only then steps off the path. Why?
1. The woman was on a cliff edge when she first saw the bear so she couldn't step off the path immediately.
2. By moving towards the bear momentarily, the woman minimizes the risk of being catch by the bear.
3. By moving towards the oncoming bear, the woman's brain interprets the change in distance and relative motion as a decrease in speed.

The brother of a police passed away, but the dead man actually had no brother. How is that possible?
1. The man is a criminal and too ashamed to admit he has a police brother.
2. The police's brother is a murderer.
3. The police was the man's sister.

One the final exam day, Tom's father send him to one classroom. A teacher came over and said " Tom can not take exam under my supervise as he is my son." Then Tom is asked to switch to another room. Why? 
1. Because the teacher is the mother of the Tom.
2. The son has two fathers.
3. Tom's father suddenly realizing that he was assigned as the supervisor.

Even in the harshest of droughts, a man living in New York City would never drink from the Mississippi River. Why not?
1. Mississippi river water are toxic.
2. The Mississippi River doesn't flow through New York City.
3. Water from Mississippi river are not part of his traditional or cultural diet.

A man accidentally stumbled and fell into a 1-meter-deep pool. He couldn't swim at all, and there were no other people around him, but he was fine at the end. Why?
1. He can wait until water level is high enough, he can safely step out of the pool. 
2. He can just stand up as the pool is only 1 meter deep.
3. 
He can wait until the water evaporates completely.

Six women were hiking on a trail when a sudden snowfall began. Five of the women hurried along, but the sixth did not. Still, they all reached the cabin at the same time, and all but the sixth were cold. How is that possible?
1. The 6th woman beated them at the end.
2. The sixth woman was in a photograph that one of the others was carrying.
3. The 6th woman walked slowly to dodge the snow.

Tom received an invitation to a holiday party. He was shocked to discover that no single person was at the party. The party is still filled with singing, though. How is that even doable?
1. The music is not good as normal people.
2. The singing is came from the food on party.
3. All people at the party except Tom is married.

How can a pilot take off in Los Angeles on Tuesday, fly for 48 hours, and land in Tokyo on Tuesday?
1. The pilot's airplane is named Tuesday.
2. He fiies straightly for 24 hours and flies quickly for the hours left.
3. There was a one-week long holidays.

The king's horse was bitten by a tiger one day while hunting. The king was so furious that he punished the tiger by sending him to a cell and depriving him of food. One year later, the bishop offended the king with a joke. The king imprisoned the bishop in the same cell as a tiger for a month. But a month later, the bishop was completely unharmed and free. How is that even doable? 
1. Since the tiger haven't eaten in one year it will have died.
2. Tiger eats the bishop slowly and bishop gets recovered everyday.
3. The bishop is a good person.

A bus journeying through the desert had six women aboard. Suddenly, the bus breaks down in the middle of nowhere and all six women have to walk under the scorching sun. Yet, not a single woman gets sunburnt! Why?
1. A woman's skin is thick enough to withstand the sun's rays
2. There came a big cloud which covered the sun for several minutes.
3. Because they were all married and not single.

Friday, Jason and Kobe go to a restaurant for dinner. The waiter gave three sets of knives and forks to their table. Why?
1. The restaurant is too expensive.
2. Friday is also the name of one person, there are three people in total.
3. Kobe likes eating with two knives and two forks.

Each and every day, a man gets up early to work out. He always spends a few hours running about his apartments. He surprises himself by discovering that, after a month of hard training, his left leg has acquired much more muscle than his right. How is that feasible since the man is normal and healthy?
1. The man ran in a circular clockwise direction around his apartment. The left leg traveled a greater distance than inside leg.
2. Because the Earth is not a perfect sphere.
3. He may have a subtle bias or preference for using his right leg more than his left.

A man bought a plane ticket to visit his hometown and landed in the next century. How did this happen?
1. The pilot got lost and spent the whole year to find the way.
2. He boarded the plane on New Year's Eve and arrived after midnight on New Year's Day of the next century.
3. The plane was too far away.

I break down walls and devour towers. I consume iron and corrode steel, but still, I am essential to all. Sometimes, people desire me, yet they fear my uncontrolled presence. What am I?
1. I am oxygen.
2. I am sunshine.
3. I am sound.

In Jamaica, some kids can stand on the water at 20 degrees Fahrenheit, how is that possible?
1. Kids in Jamaica have lower density than water.
2. The water in Jamaica is not dirty
3. At 20 degrees Fahrenheit the water would be ice.

Mary was enjoying a peaceful paddle in her inflatable kayak on a narrow river. As she turned a bend, she realized that the river became significantly narrower, too narrow for her kayak to pass through. She can't paddle backward due to the strong current. A fellow kayaker on the shore knew how to solve her predicament. What was his suggestion?
1. He suggested that she deflate her kayak slightly.
2. He suggested that she expand the river slightly.
3. He told she to overturn the kayak.

In the midst of a plumbing shutdown, Jack was stuck on the tenth floor of an apartment building fixing a leaky pipe. The elevator was out of order due to the plumbing issue. How did he manage to get out of the building before the plumbing was fixed?
1. Jack get to the roof and escape.
2. Jack used the stairs. He was fixing the leaky pipe inside the apartment, not trapped in the elevator.

3. Jack needs to lift a heavy object.

Why is Independence Day so hot?
1. Because people are enjoying the firework.
2. Because people are celebrating.
3. Because it's in July.

A man sets out to plant a flower at sunrise and his friend asks him to return by the next moonrise. But when he returns, the flower he planted has already wither and fall. How is this possible?
1. His flower grows in an amazing speed.
2. His friends waters the flower very carefully.
3. He lives in Alaska where a single day and night can last for months.

Morgan is dying near the sea line. Many people witness her death but no one feel sad. Why?
1. People are getting used to it.
2. It is a culture traditional.
3. Morgan is the name of hurricane.

A man was dancing at a ball when he unintentionally swung his arm off a glass on the table; oddly, not a drop of wine leaked. How is that possible?
1. The glass is too heavy.
2. There is no wine in the glass.
3. Surface tension prevents wine from spilling.

Emma was making a peach cobbler. After peeling and chopping all the peaches, she realized that she had to add a teaspoon of cinnamon for every four peaches. How did she figure out how much cinnamon to add?
1. She is an execellent chef.
2. She is good at physicis.
3. She counted the peach pits.

Two lighthouses are situated back to back on the same island, one faces due North and the other due South. They never turn or rotate. How can they both illuminate the same ship at the same time?
1. It is a spaceship.
2. The ship is exactly in between the two lighthouses.
3. There are reflection on the island.

A woman is found dead in a field of snow. The only tracks are her own leading up to her. There are no signs of struggle, no other footprints, and no other evidence. Only an abandoned pack of balloons is found nearby. How did she die?
1. She was in a hot air balloon which was losing altitude and crashed.
2. The womam killed herself with the toxic in ballon.
3. She was dead of a heart attack.

Without breaking any rules, a man managed to enter a ladies-only club. How is this possible?
1. The man was a security guard at the club.
2. The club wanted to make fun of the man.
3. He succeeded in getting away from the security.

There is a man who everyone calls "Lightning," yet he's afraid of storms and has no interest in meteorology. Despite this, he is delighted when people refer to him as "Lightning." How could this be?
1. He's a professional sprinter.
2. He is afraid others will laugh at him.
3. He tries to be friendly.

A woman living in Rome legally gave birth to five children, but she has never been pregnant. How is this possible?
1. The woman is a surrogate mother.
2. His husband is not a good husband.
3. The woman is not a good person.

Juliana and Maria went out for drinks collectively. They placed a joint drink order. In the time it took Maria to finish one, Juliana, who was extremely thirsty, finished five. Then Juliana went out for a phone call and came back several minutes later. However, there were new liquid in the five finished drinks. Maria didn't leap her drink to Juliana's and no one is around. How is that possible?
1. The water vapor in the air become water in the drinks.
2. The glass had a chemical component to produce water.
3. The ice in the drinks melted and become water.

A woman sells a bottle of perfume to a man for $5.00 and receives a $20 bill from him. She doesn't have change, so she goes to the bakery next door to get it. She comes back and gives the man $15.00. After the man leaves, the baker comes over and says, "That bill you gave me was counterfeit." The woman gives the baker a real $20 bill. How much has the woman lost?
1. Fifteen dollars.
2. Fifteen dollars plus the perfume.
3. Twenty-five dollars.

How can a man goes to football team every day but doesn't play football at all.
1. He is a coach.
2. Every day the weather is raining.
3. The football team will play tennis sometime.

A famed pilot walks 100 yards away from his plane, puts on a blindfold, and then flies his plane through a ring hanging in the sky, all without any technological assistance or help from others. His vision was entirely obscured by the blindfold. How did he do this?
1. He receives technological assistance stealthy.
2. He uses the sound to feel the direction.
3. Before putting on the blindfold, the pilot attached the ring to the front of his plane.

There are many people in the park when a woman shoots in public toward them, but no one is killed. How is that even doable?
1. She is bad at shooting.
2. She is afraid of the police.
3. She is a photographer.

He had a happy childhood and family, but he hasn't received a birthday present for three years recently. Why?
1. He was born on February 29.

2. Family members are sick.
3. The man is not healthy.

A man took his son to a baseball game. The coach of the team saw the man and said, "That boy is my son." Yet, the man at the baseball game was the boy's father. How is that possible?
1. The coach of the team is the boy's mother.
2. The boy has two fathers.
3. The boy's father gets a promotion.

Emily stands outside a building. She doesn't know what time it is, but she knows she has to go in to find out. Where is Emily?
1. Cafe.
2. Bakery.
3. Clock store.

John family puts a lot of emphasis on birthdays to build rapport with each other, however, this year, no one even mention John's birthday at all. Why?
1. He was born on February 29th

2. Family members are sick.
3. The man is not healthy.

To go where he was going, the man had to cross the rivers. He was unable to utilize his inflatable raft because of a notice prohibiting boats and swimming on the bank. He finally succeeded in crossing the river. The only bridge on the river was broken. How didn't the man manage to do that?
1. The river was frozen.
2. He detoured for a long distance to avoid acrossing the river.
3. He jumped half-mile far to across the river.

Which year in the history that New Year's arrive before Christmas?
1. 2020.0
2. Every year.

3. 2000.0

It turns out that Sandy was being truthful when she said she had seen an forest devoid of leaves. How is it even doable?

1. Sandy saw the forest on a map.
2. The forest is experiencing a heavy rain.
3. The forest is experiencing a heavy snow.

James lives in a remote mountainous region that experiences heavy snowfall during the winter season. He wants to set up a cozy cabin on a picturesque plateau, but he needs to transport construction materials and furniture to the location. Unfortunately, there are no roads or accessible paths to reach the plateau. How does James overcome this challenge?
1. He waits for the heavy snowfall during the winter months and uses a sled to transport the construction materials and furniture.
2. He borrows necessary materials from her neighborhood. Her neighborhood is rich and friendly.
3. He drives a plane to load all the material he needs to the island.

A girl was hanging around in the countryside. She slipped and fell into a 60-foot well, yet she didn't get wet. How is this possible?
1. The well is too deep.
2. The water is too hot.
3. The well is dry.

If the vise captain of a ship were to step down, who is supposed to take command?
1. The first officer.
2. The captain.
3. The second officer.

A sudden rustling noise startles the hiker as he explores a remote forest. He turns around to see a man emerging from the bushes. "Oops, wrong trail," the man says with a sheepish smile. He then retraces his steps and disappears into the wilderness. The hiker, feeling uneasy, decides to take precautionary measures. What made the hiker suspicious of the man?
1. The hiker knows this man on the newspaper.
2. The hiker thought the man is rude.
3. If he had genuinely taken the wrong trail, he would have been more likely to ask for directions or consult a map.

Two mothers and two daughters go shopping. They equally split the $21 they have between them. How on earth is this even possible?
1. Seven dollar is enough for two girls.
2. One mother gave her dollars to two girls.
3. The group included a grandmother, her daughter and her daughter's daughter.

A new explorer got lost while travelling. She decided to walk 3 miles to the south and made an eastward turn, and ran 3 miles. Suddenly she realized it was the wrong way then she decided to walk 3 miles to the north. Amazingly, she went back to the point of departure. Where is she?
1. South Pole.
2. Equator.

3. North Pole.

Why is the value of 1990 dollars higher than 1989 dollars ?
1. Because there is one more dollars.

2. Old money weight more than new money.
3. Old money is dirtier than new money.

A star baseball pitcher threw the baseball 1 mile far, and it miraculously returned to him? How is that possible.
1. The wind is so strong that the ball doesn't fly so far.
2. He threw it up.

3. There is a rope between the ball and the boy.

A person was outside when it started snowing heavily. Even though he was directly exposed to the snowfall without any protection, not a single snowflake landed on his hair. How is this possible?
1. The man succeeded in avoiding all snow flake.
2. The outside whether is changing frequently.
3. He is bold.

There are 5 friends. Friend 1 is palying hide and seek. Friend 2 is playing guitar. Friend 3 is reading a book. Friend 4 is swimming. What is Friend 5 doing?
1. Friend 5 is swimming.
2. Friend 5 is reading.
3. Friend 5 is palying hide and seek.

On May 1, a boy flew to Japan to participate in a festival for five days before returning on May 1. How did he manage that?
1. The boy drank a lot and slept at festival for 5 days.
2. He went over on the date of the 1st of May and came home on the airplane named the May 1.
3. May 6th is holiday.

Despite being in June, David's birthday is never in the summer. Why? 
1. His family will hold a huge celebration for him.
2. He lives in Australia.
3. He alwasy gets cold in winter.

The same restaurant was in two friends calendars for the same hour, day, and month. They did not, however, cross paths. How is that even doable?
1. One person is richer than the other.
2. One person focuses on the delicious food so much.
3. They ddin't go in the same year.

A man went to sleep with the light on. However, his boss didn't blame for wasting electricity him after seeing that. Why?
1. The man is a world-renowned botanist moved into a rare greenhouse.
2. The man is a calendar maker.
3. The man lived in a lighthouse.

Two person had to go to the top of the hill. There's only one motorcycle, yet only one person can ride it. Fortunately, they both get to the top of the hill. How?
1. One men go home to get a another motorcycle.
2. They find a good view.
3. One person is already at the top of the hill.

A black dog stands in the middle of an intersection in a town that has been painted black. None of the street lights are working due to a storm-related power loss. When a car approaching the dog with two damaged headlights, it moves aside in time to miss him. How was the motorist able to spot the dog in time?
1. The driver is good at smelling.
2. It was day time.

3. The driver was paying much attention.

A boy accidentally walked into a 10-foot deep pool, yet he didn't get wet. How is this possible?
1. The pool is too deep.
2. The pool was empty.
3. The pool is too hot.

Strolling in a snow-covered field, a woman is amazed to see her own snow angel clearly. She hasn't turned around. How is this possible?
1. The snow angel will move all over around with snow.
2. The reflection by the snow let she saw the snow angel.
3. She was moving backwards while making the snow angel.

Soccer was being played between two teams. Team One had a player who score two balls in a role. Team TWO doesn't have a player scoring due to the good defense of Team One. However, Team One still loss the game. Why?
1. His teammates is envy about him.
2. The player scored in their own goal.
3. His team didn't pay attention on defense.

Johnson is a famous doctors in the world and benefit mankind greatly. However, he never been to a medical school. How is that possible?
1. Woman's sons learned all their knowledge by themselves.
2. Woman's sons are too busy to take courses in medical school.
3. Johnson is a "doctors" in the academic sense

Two farmers got into a heated argument and started fighting. A farmer was so enraged that he threw a handful of stones at the other farmer. The stones hit the farmer exactly, but the other farmer received no harm at all.  Why?
1. The stones was actually seeds, not ordinary stones. The seed of a cherry is called a stone.
2. The stones were small or lacked enough force to cause any significant injury.
3. The other farmer was wearing protective clothing or had some form of shield that prevented the stones from causing harm.

A one-story house is built from red bricks. The doors, windows, and roof are all made of red bricks. What color is the basement?
1. There is no basement in a one-story house built on a single floor.
2. It should be red as the whole house is in red.
3. The basement is uncolored as the basement is only used for storing stuffs.

A conscientious farmer formerly provided food for his roosters each day, but throughout the years, not a single egg was produced for him. How is it even imaginable?
1. Because roosters don't lay eggs.
2. Roosters will eat their own eggs once they were laid.
3. His neighbor always stolen eggs away from him.

How can you leave your office with two legs and come back with a dog but still two legs
1. You're riding on the dog yourself.
2. You're carrying the dog yourself.
3. You're walking back upside down.

A thief was walking down the street. He walked past the security guards and also the people whom he had stolen from. Nevertheless, nobody was catching him. So why not?
1. The people whom he had stolen is kind and rich.
2. At that time, he was just walking down the street. He stolen from others previously.
3. He tried to get away from the security and succeeded in the end.

There were two bosses and two employees in a meeting room discussing different tasks. At the end of the meeting, there three tasks for all the people in that meeting. How is that possible
1. There was one boss with his employee, and that employee was somebody else's boss.
2. Two employees shared the same task.
3. One boss gaves his fish to his employee.

The sea was really stormy, it was raining heavily and it was a cold night, however the crew were completely comfortable and warm. How is that possible? 
1. The crew finally got their monthly salary.
2. The crew could understand the extreme whether.
3. The crew were not cruising in the sea.

Jimy went in the middle of the warzone and bombarded a lot of territories that were in the possession of the enemy. When he got back, he didn't get any medals or any praises. Why?
1. Jimy was the name of the fighter-jet that was flying over enemy's territory.
2. Jimy was really sweaty and smells.
3. Jimy is could not lift the trophy because it was too heavy.

There was an employee that told on his resume that he will do anything that he will be told be to. Nonetheless, on the first day of job in the manufacturing company, his boss was really annoyed as he wasn't doing anything his boss was showing him to do. What was the problem ? 
1. The man was blind and they had to explicitly tell him what to do not to show him
2. The man was tired and doesn't want to anything anymore.
3. The man thought the first day of the job should be a hoilday.

Two men are using a ladder but both are face-to-face and can't pass each other. How's that physically possible ?
1. The two man are using the ladder alternatively.
2. The ladder is set horizontally and two people are hanging from it one going from left to right and the other one from right to left
3. With the help of optical illusions,both you and your friend can not pass each other.

Two men were working in the same store with the same shift and same tasks given to them, however they were not seeing each other at all. How can this be possible?
1. They both didn't focus on their work.
2. They were too busy to see each other.
3. They were living in different periods of time and both working in that store.

A group of people were shooting each other. They shot their friends in heads and also in other parts of the bodies. They had a lot of pain but nobody died. How is that possible?
1. No one was seriously injured.
2. There was a hospital nearby.
3. They were using fake guns like in paint ball

A thief was running when he passed a policeman as well, but nobody stopped him. Why?

Picture Robert, an adept circus performer, carrying five silver spheres, each weighing two kilograms. While trekking, he stumbles upon a rickety old bridge with a sign pronouncing that it can only bear a maximum of 90 kilograms. The silver spheres weigh ten kilograms and Robert weighs 81 kilograms. Robert sees the sign and crosses the bridge securely with all his treasures. How did he manage to do this?
1. Robert is a clown so he has mastered juggling. When he came to the bridge he judged the gold, always keeping one piece in the air.
2. Robert burried one silver sphere in the start of the bridge and make sure the location is private enough that no one can find.
3. Robert sank the silver sphere to the bottom of the river and left a mark so that he could find it later.

2. They were sitting on the rounded table and all of them were doing the same thing.
3. There were no food on the table.
